Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.utils

Interface State

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BitwiseEnum, Flag, UsesCustomNull
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BleDeviceState, BleManagerState, BleServerState
    public interface State
extends UsesCustomNull, BitwiseEnum
    Bitwise enum contract for representing the state of devices and managers. Implementations are BleDeviceState and BleManagerState. Not intended for subclassing outside this library but go wild if you want.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  State.ChangeEvent<T_State extends State>
      Abstract base class for DeviceStateListener.StateEvent and ManagerStateListener.StateEvent.
      static class  State.ChangeIntent
      Enumerates the intention behind a state change - as comprehensively as possible, whether the application user intended for the state change to happen or not.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean didEnter​(int oldStateBits, int newStateBits)
      Given an old and new state mask, for example from DeviceStateListener.onEvent(com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.DeviceStateListener.StateEvent) or ManagerStateListener.onEvent(com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.ManagerStateListener.StateEvent), this method tells you whether the the 'this' state was appended.
      boolean didExit​(int oldStateBits, int newStateBits)
      Reverse of didEnter(int, int).
      boolean isNull()
      Returns true if this state is meant to stand in for Java's built-in null.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.utils.BitwiseEnum

        name, or, or, overlaps

      • Methods inherited from interface com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.utils.Flag

        bit, ordinal

    • Method Detail

      • didEnter

        boolean didEnter​(int oldStateBits,
                 int newStateBits)
        Given an old and new state mask, for example from DeviceStateListener.onEvent(com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.DeviceStateListener.StateEvent) or ManagerStateListener.onEvent(com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.ManagerStateListener.StateEvent), this method tells you whether the the 'this' state was appended.
        See Also:
        didExit(int, int)

      • didExit

        boolean didExit​(int oldStateBits,
                int newStateBits)
        Reverse of didEnter(int, int).
        See Also:
        didEnter(int, int)

      • isNull

        boolean isNull()
        Returns true if this state is meant to stand in for Java's built-in null.
        Specified by:
        isNull in interface UsesCustomNull
